Ahh got it üëç ‚Äî Yes, Flutter has a verbose mode which prints everything it‚Äôs doing under the hood so you can see where it hangs.

‚úÖ Run flutter Commands with Verbose Logging

Just add the -v (or --verbose) flag:

  • For flutter clean: 
    flutter clean -v
  • For fetching dependencies: 
    flutter pub get -v
  • For running your app: 
    flutter run -v

This will dump detailed logs (network calls, file deletions, pod commands, etc.) to the terminal.

üìå Tips for Reading Verbose Logs

  • Look at the last few lines shown before it stops responding ‚Üí that tells you what step is hanging.
  • Often hangs happen during:
    • CocoaPods resolution (network slow / repo outdated).
    • Gradle sync (on Android build).
    • Permissions (if Flutter doesn‚Äôt have access to some directories).
